intro: Tibetia liangshanensis, commonly known as the Liangshan Tibetia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan Province in China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hair. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
